etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in William Edward Hearn (1826–1888), legal and economic writer

definitions: A group or association of organisms which behaves in some respect like a single organism; a complex system consisting of a large number of organisms which itself behaves as if it were an organic whole, as human society, an ecosystem, etc.

notes.text: Reported earlier use by James Hutton has not been verified, though he outlined the concept in 1785 (in a paper published in 1788: see Trans. Royal Soc. Edinb. 1 216).
